remarks: Property of a disjoint collection: if ` B ( x ) ` and ` B ( Y ) = D ` have a common element ` Z ` , then ` x = Y ` .  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Dec-2016.)
statement:
disjif.1 $e |- F/_ x C $.
disjif.2 $e |- ( x = Y -> B = C ) $.
disjif $p |- ( ( Disj_ x e. A B /\ ( x e. A /\ Y e. A ) /\ ( Z e. B /\ Z e. C ) ) -> x = Y ) $.
$d A x $.
$d Y x $.
